TLINE.TDLINE: &USE&
In principle, the pricing procedure is used by the gicom evaluation
component. Thereupon the revenue demands are calculated. Even though the
evaluation component uses the pricing procedure, the maintenance of the
previously defined condition types is required. Otherwise an error is
displayed in the AD. The pricing procedure is also required for any
future simulation.
&PRECONDITIONS&
&STANDARD_SETUP&
&ACTIVITY&
The pricing procedure divided into header data and position data. It is
maintained via the view cluster /GICOM/VC_PRPRCD.
Step1: Header data
The header data includes an ID and the checkbox which determines whether
it’s a standard pricing procedure or not. Once the header is defined the
relevant condition types can be determined at position level. Condition
types are inserted automatically into the gicom standard bar. This
guarantees that the condition type is considered for all processes that
use the standard bar. If deviating and/or supplier specific bars are
used, further customizing will be required.
Step2: Position data
The positions for the single bars are generated with the following
parameters
·,,Step: Defines the step within the scheme. The scheme will be run
through ascending within the evaluation.
·,,Condition type: Indicates the condition type for which the conditions
are retrieved for the calculation. Only the condition type base must be
indicated. Additive variants of condition types are considered
automatically in the evaluation. Additive conditions of a condition type
therein have no reference base reducing effect.
·,,Title of cond. type: The name of the condition type in the language
of the registration.
·,,Ref. step C: This displays a reference value (corresponding to a step
from the current bar) the condition refers to. The reference value is
always calculated by the gross value from which all conditions are
deducted up to the specified condition reference step. For purposes of
unification and transparency one reference step must be specified for
each condition type.
·,,Tip: For fixed amount conditions and conditions with alternative
quantity units, the reference scale must always include the first step,
which should refer to the condition type 0001, because these conditions
refer to the net product value.
